meanings.definition: A type of stele in plants characterized by a central pith surrounded by vascular tissue.
meanings.sent1: The siphonostele of the plant helps transport water efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The botanist studied the siphonostele of the fern to understand its structure.
meanings.sent3: The siphonostele of the tree seemed to be the talk of the plant world.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of the siphonostele was as deep as the roots of the ancient oak.
meanings.sent5: The intricate siphonostele resembled a bustling highway for nutrients.

meanings.definition: To form a siphonostele in a plant.
meanings.sent1: The gardener carefully siphonosteles the new plant for optimal growth.
meanings.sent2: Plants naturally siphonostele to adapt to their environment.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he could siphonostele a plant blindfolded.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to siphonostele plants was like a green thumb superpower.
meanings.sent5: Watching her siphonostele the delicate flower was like witnessing magic in the garden.
